page.title: 06FAUNA AND WEATHER IN ASHILL
page.content: Foxes are the largest animals resident in the village but they are rarely seen. The old railway line being their favourite haunt. Hares are common on the large open fields and in March can be seen playing in the growing corn. Rabbits, Rats, House and Field Mice, Moles and Shrews are all common and the first few are considered pests and killed by various means. In summer dusk brings out several bats. Frogs and Toads are plentiful. The village,being on top of a hill, is particularly affected by the wind, only Church St. seems to escape, and it is said to be "2 coats warmer" than the rest of the village. This winter we endured 2 periods of a fortnight of very low temperatures followed by an unusually dull spring and summer, Autumn looks like being warmer than usual.
